content:
InMemorySymmetricSecurityKey Class

Definition

Represents keys that are generated using symmetric algorithms and are only stored in the local computer's random access memory.

In this Article

public class InMemorySymmetricSecurityKey : System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SymmetricSecurityKey
Inheritance
Object
SecurityKey
System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SymmetricSecurityKey
InMemorySymmetricSecurityKey

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

Typically, this class is only used by the infrastructure to transform XML using a symmetric key.

Constructors

InMemorySymmetricSecurityKey(Byte[])

Initializes a new instance of the InMemorySymmetricSecurityKey class using the specified symmetric key.

public InMemorySymmetricSecurityKey (byte[] symmetricKey);
symmetricKey
Byte[]

An array of Byte that contains the symmetric key.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

symmetricKey is null.

ArgumentException

symmetricKey is zero length.

InMemorySymmetricSecurityKey(Byte[],Boolean)

Initializes a new instance of the InMemorySymmetricSecurityKey class using the specified symmetric key and a value that indicates whether the binary data must be cloned.

public InMemorySymmetricSecurityKey (byte[] symmetricKey, bool cloneBuffer);
symmetricKey
Byte[]

An array of Byte that contains the symmetric key.

cloneBuffer
Boolean

true to clone the array passed into the symmetricKey parameter; otherwise, false.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

symmetricKey is null.

ArgumentException

symmetricKey is zero length.

Properties

KeySize

Gets the size, in bits, of the key.

public override int KeySize { get; }
Value
Int32

The size, in bits, of the key.

Methods

DecryptKey(String,Byte[])

Decrypts the specified encrypted key.

public override byte[] DecryptKey (string algorithm, byte[] keyData);
algorithm
String

The cryptographic algorithm that was used to encrypt the key.

keyData
Byte[]

An array of Byte that contains the encrypted key.

Returns
Byte[]

An array of Byte that contains the decrypted key.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

algorithm is not supported. The supported algorithms are TripleDesKeyWrap, Aes128KeyWrap, Aes192KeyWrap, and Aes256KeyWrap.

Remarks

Use the static fields of the SecurityAlgorithms class to specify the algorithm.

EncryptKey(String,Byte[])

Encrypts the specified key.

public override byte[] EncryptKey (string algorithm, byte[] keyData);
algorithm
String

The cryptographic algorithm to encrypt the key with.

keyData
Byte[]

An array of Byte that contains the key.

Returns
Byte[]

An array of Byte that contains the encrypted key.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

algorithm is not supported. The supported algorithms are TripleDesKeyWrap, Aes128KeyWrap, Aes192KeyWrap, or Aes256KeyWrap.

Remarks

Use the static fields of the SecurityAlgorithms class to specify the algorithm.

GenerateDerivedKey(String,Byte[],Byte[],Int32,Int32)

Generates a derived key using the specified cryptographic algorithm and parameters for the current key.

public override byte[] GenerateDerivedKey (string algorithm, byte[] label, byte[] nonce, int derivedKeyLength, int offset);
algorithm
String

A URI that represents the cryptographic algorithm to use to generate the derived key.

label
Byte[]

An array of Byte that contains the label parameter for the cryptographic algorithm.

nonce
Byte[]

An array of Byte that contains the nonce that is used to create a derived key.

derivedKeyLength
Int32

The size of the derived key.

offset
Int32

The position at which the derived key is located in the byte array that is returned from this method.

Returns
Byte[]

An array of Byte that contains the derived key.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

algorithm is not supported. The supported algorithms is Psha1KeyDerivation.

Remarks

To specify P-SHA1 as the cryptographic algorithm, use the Psha1KeyDerivation field.

GetDecryptionTransform(String,Byte[])

Gets a transform that decrypts cipher text using the specified cryptographic algorithm.

public override System.Security.Cryptography.ICryptoTransform GetDecryptionTransform (string algorithm, byte[] iv);
algorithm
String

A cryptographic algorithm that decrypts cipher text, such as encrypted XML.

iv
Byte[]

An array of Byte that contains the initialization vector (IV) for the specified algorithm.

Returns
ICryptoTransform

An ICryptoTransform that represents the decryption transform.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

algorithm is not supported. The supported algorithms are TripleDesEncryption, Aes128Encryption, Aes192Encryption, and Aes256Encryption.

Remarks

Use the fields that represent decryption algorithms in the SecurityAlgorithms class to specify the algorithm.

GetEncryptionTransform(String,Byte[])

Gets a transform that encrypts XML using the specified cryptographic algorithm.

public override System.Security.Cryptography.ICryptoTransform GetEncryptionTransform (string algorithm, byte[] iv);
algorithm
String

A cryptographic algorithm that encrypts XML.

iv
Byte[]

An array of Byte that contains the initialization vector (IV) for the specified algorithm.

Returns
ICryptoTransform

An ICryptoTransform that represents the encryption transform.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

algorithm is not supported. The supported algorithms are TripleDesEncryption, Aes128Encryption, Aes192Encryption, and Aes256Encryption.

Remarks

Use the fields that represent encryption algorithms in the SecurityAlgorithms class to specify the algorithm.

GetIVSize(String)

Gets the size, in bits, of the initialization vector (IV) that is required for the specified cryptographic algorithm.

public override int GetIVSize (string algorithm);
algorithm
String

The cryptographic algorithm to get the size of the initialization vector (IV).

Returns
Int32

The size, in bits, of the initialization vector (IV) that is required for the cryptographic algorithm specified in the algorithm parameter.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

algorithm is not supported. The supported algorithms are TripleDesEncryption, Aes128Encryption, Aes192Encryption, and Aes256Encryption.

Remarks

Use the fields that represent encryption algorithms in the SecurityAlgorithms class to specify the algorithm.

GetKeyedHashAlgorithm(String)

Gets an instance of the specified keyed hash algorithm.

public override System.Security.Cryptography.KeyedHashAlgorithm GetKeyedHashAlgorithm (string algorithm);
algorithm
String

The keyed hash algorithm to get an instance of.

Returns
KeyedHashAlgorithm

A KeyedHashAlgorithm that represents the keyed hash algorithm.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

algorithm is not supported. The supported algorithms is HmacSha1Signature.

GetSymmetricAlgorithm(String)

Gets an instance of the specified symmetric algorithm.

public override System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm GetSymmetricAlgorithm (string algorithm);
algorithm
String

The symmetric algorithm to get an instance of.

Returns
SymmetricAlgorithm

A SymmetricAlgorithm that represents the symmetric algorithm.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

algorithm is not supported. The supported algorithms are TripleDesEncryption, Aes128Encryption, Aes192Encryption, Aes256Encryption, TripleDesKeyWrap, Aes128KeyWrap, Aes192KeyWrap, and Aes256KeyWrap

GetSymmetricKey()

Gets the bytes that represent the symmetric key.

public override byte[] GetSymmetricKey ();
Returns
Byte[]

An array of Byte that contains the symmetric key.

IsAsymmetricAlgorithm(String)

Gets a value that indicates whether the specified algorithm uses asymmetric keys.

public override bool IsAsymmetricAlgorithm (string algorithm);
algorithm
String

The cryptographic algorithm.

Returns
Boolean

true when the specified algorithm uses asymmetric keys; otherwise, false.

IsSupportedAlgorithm(String)

Gets a value that indicates whether the specified algorithm is supported by this class.

public override bool IsSupportedAlgorithm (string algorithm);
algorithm
String

The cryptographic algorithm.

Returns
Boolean

true when the specified algorithm is supported by this class; otherwise, false.

Remarks

The symmetric algorithms that are supported by this class are the algorithms represented by the following fields:

  • HmacSha1Signature
  • Psha1KeyDerivation
  • Aes128Encryption
  • Aes128KeyWrap
  • Aes192Encryption
  • Aes192KeyWrap
  • Aes256Encryption
  • Aes256KeyWrap
  • TripleDesEncryption
  • TripleDesKeyWrap

IsSymmetricAlgorithm(String)

Gets a value that indicates whether the specified algorithm uses symmetric keys.

public override bool IsSymmetricAlgorithm (string algorithm);
algorithm
String

The cryptographic algorithm.

Returns
Boolean

true when the specified algorithm uses symmetric keys; otherwise, false.
